intro: Carpentaria acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved screw pine, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Pandanaceae family and is characterized by its spiral arrangement of leaves and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into fleshy, red berries. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found growing on sandy soils or rocky substrates. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitats.
